result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Curry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --To pay fine of $600  + costs= $1694, plus to pay $56.74 in blood testing costs that were incurred by the Fort Atkinson Police Department; to be paid in $50 per month installments, commencing on 3/1/15 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in entry of a civil judgment for the unpaid balance

FORTHWITH
--With Huber privileges

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process

--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--6 demerit points assessed
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 24 month period

--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
-Jefferson County Victim Impact Panel attendance

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268, DNA surcharge of $250, plus $90 in subpoena fees
--to reimburse the Fort Atkinson Police Department $100 in drug testing fees

--to undergo AODA assessment and comply with all treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--random urinalyses or other drug testing; the Court recommends no fewer than two tests per month during the first year
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
---no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possesion of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--to continue treatment for the underlying mental health issues of depression and anxiety until released by the therapist
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed. 
--to comply with DNA sample provision

Arresting Agency:  Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
To commence when the service of the jail term on Count #1 is complete
--With work release

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

supervisions.notes: All outstanding financial obligations are to be converted to entry of civil judgments.
All outstanding financial obligations are to be converted to entry of civil judgments.

Count #2 - 
Court sentences the defenant  to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and 3 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 9 months.  This sentence is to  be served concurrent with the sentence ordered in Count #6 and consecutive to any other sentence in being.  

As to both counts - 
The Court finds that the Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Earned Credit Program. 
The Court gives 60 days credit for time already served. (Dates of service - 9/18/14 - 11/16/14.)

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:48am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Michael  Curry in court with Attorney Peter Wolff.  Defendant Michael  Curry in custody.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing recommendations presented by Counsel. 
Narrative statement presented by the Defendant. 

The Court orders:
Count #2 - 
Court sentences the defenant  to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and 3 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 9 months.  This sentence is to  be served concurrent with the sentence ordered in Count #6 and consecutive to any other sentence in being. 

Count #6 - 
Court sentences 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year  &  3 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 9 months.  This sentence is to  be served concurrent with the sentence ordered in Count #6 and consecutive to any other sentence in being. 

As to both counts - 
The Court finds that the Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Earned Credit Program. 
The Court gives 60 days credit for time already served. (Dates of service - 9/18/14 - 11/16/14.)

All outstanding financial obligations are to be converted to entry of civil judgments. 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--  Absolute Sobriety
--  No possession of non-prescribed controlled substances, alcohol or designer drugs. 
--  Any prescribed medicaions are to be possessed and ingested only as they are prescribed. 
--  Random urinalysis per the Agent. 
--  Any other treatement and/or counseling per the Agent. 
--  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 

Felony Firearm prohibition/warnings given orally.
Voting ineligibility form given

records.addlTxt:
[Clerk: MK]
case called at 10:18am. 
Defendant Michael  Curry in court with Attorney Yelena O. Zarwell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3, #4, and #6; factual basis stipulated including as to prior convictions; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Curry guilty of these counts, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #5, #7, and #8. 

On agreement of the parties, the Court orders entry of judgment in favor of the Petitioner in Case #14CV93, resulting in a forfeiture of the $1260 amount. 

On Count # 1, the Court sentences Mr. Curry: 
--To serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith
--Days credit for time already served: 1 day
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $600  + costs= $1694, plus to pay $56.74 in blood testing costs that were incurred by the Fort Atkinson Police Department; to be paid in $50 per month installments, commencing on 3/1/15 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in entry of a civil judgment for the unpaid balance
--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
-Jefferson County Victim Impact Panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 24 month period 
--6 demerit points assessed
---------------------------------------------------------------------

On Counts #2, #3, #4 and #6, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Curry on Probation for four years, with conditions:
--on Count  #2 only, to serve 30 days conditional jail with work release, to commence when the service of the jail term on Count #1 is complete
--on Count #6, to serve 30 days conditional jail, with work release, to commence when the service of the jail term in Count #2 is complete 
--to undergo AODA assessment and comply with all treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--random urinalyses or other drug testing; the Court recommends no fewer than two tests per month during the first year
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
---no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possesion of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--to continue treatment for the underlying mental health issues of depression and anxiety until released by the therapist
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed. 
--to reimburse the Fort Atkinson Police Department $100 in drug testing fees 
--as to Counts #2 and #6: to comply with DNA sample provision
--on Count #2: to pay costs of $268, DNA surcharge of $250, plus $90 in subpoena fees
--on Count #3: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--on Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--on Count #6: to pay costs of $268, DNA surcharge of $250

Days credit as to Counts #2, #3, #45, #6:  0 days 
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given.
recess 11:22am.
Letters submitted in support of the defendant , filed by Attorney Y Zarwell
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 18, 2014 at 09:45 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 3:04pm. 
Defendant Michael  Curry in court with Attorney Yelena O. Zarwell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court hears arguments on the Defendant's Motion for Continance of the FSSC and Jury Trial scheduled for next week.  
Attorney Zarwell requests that the case be scheduled for status conference at the end of September; there is an intended plea agreement.  Attorney Zarwell
indicates that Mr. Curry has been involved in outpatient AODA treatment and he just had a psychological evaluation. Attorney Zarwell has received written confirmation of this.  The evaluation report should be finalized in approximately three weeks. Attorney Zarwell would like to have these records before proceeding to plea/sentencing because she believes they will be relevant to treatment needs and which type of sentencing outcome is most appropriate.
The Court grants the Motion for Continuance. 
The Court emphasizes to Mr. Curry that the conditions of Bond remain in effect.
Mr. Curry verifies that the Grayslake, IL address remains current. 
recess 3:10pm. 

NEXT:  schedule Plea/Sentencing in mid-to-late September

case called at 9:16am. 
Defendant Michael Curry appears in court with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Curry waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds Mr. Curry over for trial. 

Arraignment: 
--service of Information admitted; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all seven counts.
Mr. Curry verifies that the Grayslake address is accurate.
recess 9:19am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/23/14 at 8:40am.  (2) schedule Status Conference after the Pretrial date

Case called at 8:44 am  (case was set for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing)
Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews that Notice of Hearing was resent on March 11, 2014 to Lake St. in Illinois.
Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the defendant appeared at the Pretrial Conference, he has been in contact with her and has made all his court appearances in Rock County.

ADA Teuber requests bench warrant.
Attorney Zarwell requests that the warrant be STAYED unitl tomorrow at 10:00 am.

Court will not issue the warrant, will recall the case tomorrow at 9:00 am

recess:8:50 am

case called at 1:16pm. 
Defendant Michael Curry appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  
DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Michael Curry. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000 cash bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--not to drive without a valid drivers license
recess 1:37pm. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/12/14 at 3:00pm. (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing after the Pretrial date
